probes/syscalls.bt.description: Filtered syscall tracing: execve, openat, connect. Includes decoded args (file paths, IPs, binary paths) and ppid.

probes/binder.bt.description: Binder IPC tracing: binder_transaction (with ppid + oneway flag), binder_transaction_received, binder_transaction_alloc_buf. Correlate by debug_id.

probes/process_lifecycle.bt.description: Process lifecycle: fork, exec, exit. Includes ppid for process tree reconstruction.

probes/syscalls_latency.bt.description: Syscall latency tracking for execve, openat, connect. Captures return value and execution time in microseconds.

probes/sched_switch.bt.description: Scheduler context switches: prev/next pid and comm. High event volume â€” use for performance analysis, not security.

probes/sched_wakeup_latency.bt.description: Wakeup-to-schedule latency: time between sched_wakeup and the process actually getting CPU. Performance probe.

probes/net_bind.bt.description: Tracks bind() syscall (id=49). Decodes AF_INET ip:port and AF_UNIX socket paths. Shows which processes claim local ports.

probes/net_accept.bt.description: Tracks accept() and accept4() (id=43,288). Captures peer address on successful accept. Non-system processes accepting connections is anomalous on Android.

probes/net_send.bt.description: Tracks sendto() (id=44). Captures fd, requested bytes, actual bytes sent, and latency. Content not captured, only size.

probes/net_recv.bt.description: Tracks recvfrom() (id=45). Captures fd, buffer size, actual bytes received, and latency. Content not captured, only size.
